revised_title: Flow of Rotating Fluids in Pipe Constrictions and Expansions
tldr: This article explores the flow of a rotating, incompressible fluid through pipe contractions and expansions, or past bodies of revolution on the pipe axis. The authors construct flow fields using stream functions of a ring source on the pipe wall or a point source on the pipe axis. They discuss the physical behavior of the fluid and the importance of the parameter ratio in determining the flow patterns.
